intro: Sebastiania hispida var. ambigua, commonly known as the woolly sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. Native to South America, particularly Brazil, it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant produces yellowish-green berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable ornamental and ecological species.
